laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial sodium level of 118 mmol/L (normal 135 –145); repeat sodium level of 129 mmol/L after fluid restriction.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Sodium levels increased from 118 mmol/L to 129 mmol/L.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial whole blood bismuth level of 948 ng/mL (toxic range, normal <50); returned to normal at 9.5 ng/mL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Whole blood bismuth levels decreased from 948 ng/mL to 9.5 ng/mL.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Initial urine bismuth level of .406.5 ng/mL (toxic range, normal <50); declined to 8.6 ng/mL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Urine bismuth levels decreased from .406.5 ng/mL to 8.6 ng/mL.

laboratory_examinations.findings: All vitamin levels assessed were within normal limits.
Normal cell count, protein, and glucose; oligoclonal bands were not present.
Normal posterior rhythm, diffuse intermittent slowing in delta frequency range; no periodic sharp waves.
Elevated VGKCc autoantibodies at 0.06 nmol/L (normal <0.02 nmol/L); VGKCc in CSF was normal; all other neural antibodies were negative.
